H0.text: Which English road in Anglo-Saxon times went from Axminster via Bath, Cirencester, Leicester and Newark to Lincoln. Ermine Street

H1.text: Which English road in Anglo-Saxon times went from Axminster via Bath, Cirencester, Leicester and Newark to Lincoln. Watling Street

H2.text: Which English road in Anglo-Saxon times went from Axminster via Bath, Cirencester, Leicester and Newark to Lincoln. Icknield Way

H3.text: Which English road in Anglo-Saxon times went from Axminster via Bath, Cirencester, Leicester and Newark to Lincoln. Fosseway

A4.text: The Fosse Way runs from Exeter to Lincoln, passing through Cirencester, Leicester, and Newark-on-Trent.

A5.text: The Fosse Way is followed by a section of the A358 south of Axminster, implying its route through that area.
